column4: Hey, I'm having permission errors when I try to play a DVD in Movieplayer. I do have permissions for the cdrom drive, I've used it to install Doom 3 and UT2004
Sorry forgot to add, when ever I try to play the dvd in Movieplayer, it say's permission denied.
try running the following in a terminal and see what error you get, might give a clue "mplayer dvd://1
ignore the "
http://paste.ubuntu.com/288282/
did it also start playing?  that looks like a good log.
Now I can't even open the dvd in Movieplayer. It will start up then suddenly close.
did it work with mplayer?
One sec, I need to restart. The whole system is acting weird
Okay, the error I get is a box that says "Can not read from Resource."
you never answered - did it work with that mplayer command?
cause the log said it was playing...
mplayer never opened
what program are you trying to play it in?
The stock Movie Player program that comes with 9.04
what's it called exactly in the menu?
Movie Player
Applications=> Sound & Video=> Movie Player

see I don't have that in my menu (i probably removed it) , i do have an "Mplayer Movie Player" but not just a "Movie Player" (it's probably totem or some such thing which I don't use - and would be no help with at all)
I think it may be based off of Totem, what would be a decent dvd player to try out?
I'm afraid for me it's all mplayer - but i mostly use it from cli or scripts, but I guess I kinda like smplayer for a front end...  but lots of people prefer vlc
I'm running synaptic and the actual program name is Mplayer Movie Player
might only be in the medibuntu repo?!?
So I found out its not opening it in Mplayer. I have a program called Movie Player and Mplayer (no idea why). I'm trying to just open in Mplayer to see if it will play
